timeline.message:
Adding Remote Validator API CLI options

Signed-off-by: Lucas Saldanha <lucascrsaldanha@gmail.com>

Created Remote Validator service

Signed-off-by: Lucas Saldanha <lucascrsaldanha@gmail.com>

Hiding CLI options not in use

Signed-off-by: Lucas Saldanha <lucascrsaldanha@gmail.com>

Fix max connected validators

Signed-off-by: Lucas Saldanha <lucascrsaldanha@gmail.com>

timeline.bodyText: We have a JsonProvider class that would be good to use here instead of creating a new Gson every time.
timeline.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText: ah, so this is why we'll wind up merging this into the beacon chain instead of being its own service.  It should be using the same port as the rest of the REST API.  But we may as well delay that until we have a clear direction on what to use for delivering these events.
timeline.author: ajsutton
ajsutton

timeline.bodyText: Yeah ultimately it would have to wind up being a command line option.
timeline.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText: If you prefix these with --X they'll turn up when you run teku -X so they're easier to find.
timeline.author: ajsutton

timeline.bodyText: We've been consistently not using this in Teku.  Just using the static methods on Mockito rather than the annotations.
timeline.author: ajsutton
ajsutton

timeline.bodyText: And the nice thing about not using @Mock annotations is the values are immediately available so you can just declare these values inline rather than needing a beforeEach method.
timeline.author: ajsutton
